components.sourceCode:
import { Component, Input, Output, EventEmitter } from '@angular/core'; import { CommonModule } from '@angular/common'; import { FormsModule } from '@angular/forms'; import { MatButtonModule } from '@angular/material/button'; import { CartItem } from '../../state/cart/cart.model'; @Component({ selector: 'app-cart-item', standalone: true, imports: [CommonModule, FormsModule, MatButtonModule], template: `
No Image

{{ item.name }}

Price: {{ item.price | currency:'EUR' }}

Stock: {{ item.stock || 'N/A' }}

Exceeds stock!

` }) export class CartItemComponent { @Input() item!: CartItem & { stock?: number; imageUrl?: string }; @Output() qtyChange = new EventEmitter<{ id: number; quantity: number }>(); @Output() remove = new EventEmitter(); }

components.sourceCode:
import { Component, Input, Output, EventEmitter } from '@angular/core'; import { CommonModule } from '@angular/common'; import { ButtonComponent } from './button.component'; import type { User } from './user'; @Component({ selector: 'storybook-header', standalone: true, imports: [CommonModule, ButtonComponent], template: `

Acme

Welcome, {{ user.name }}!
`, styleUrls: ['./header.css'], }) export class HeaderComponent { @Input() user: User | null = null; @Output() onLogin = new EventEmitter(); @Output() onLogout = new EventEmitter(); @Output() onCreateAccount = new EventEmitter(); }

components.name: PageComponent
components.template:
Pages in Storybook

We recommend building UIs with a component-driven process starting with atomic components and ending with pages.

Render pages with mock data. This makes it easy to build and review page states without needing to navigate to them in your app. Here are some handy patterns for managing page data in Storybook:

  • Use a higher-level connected component. Storybook helps you compose such data from the "args" of child component stories
  • Assemble data in the page component from your services. You can mock these services out using Storybook.

Get a guided tutorial on component-driven development at Storybook tutorials . Read more in the docs .

Tip Adjust the width of the canvas with the Viewports addon in the toolbar
components.sourceCode:
import { Component } from '@angular/core'; import { CommonModule } from '@angular/common'; import { HeaderComponent } from './header.component'; import type { User } from './user'; @Component({ selector: 'storybook-page', standalone: true, imports: [CommonModule, HeaderComponent], template: `

Pages in Storybook

We recommend building UIs with a component-driven process starting with atomic components and ending with pages.

Render pages with mock data. This makes it easy to build and review page states without needing to navigate to them in your app. Here are some handy patterns for managing page data in Storybook:

  • Use a higher-level connected component. Storybook helps you compose such data from the "args" of child component stories
  • Assemble data in the page component from your services. You can mock these services out using Storybook.

Get a guided tutorial on component-driven development at Storybook tutorials . Read more in the docs .

Tip Adjust the width of the canvas with the Viewports addon in the toolbar
`, styleUrls: ['./page.css'], }) export class PageComponent { user: User | null = null; doLogout() { this.user = null; } doLogin() { this.user = { name: 'Jane Doe' }; } doCreateAccount() { this.user = { name: 'Jane Doe' }; } }

variables.name: authReducer
variables.defaultValue:
createReducer(
  initialAuthState,
  on(AuthActions.login, state => ({ ...state, loading: true, error: null })),
  on(AuthActions.loginSuccess, (state, { access, refresh }) => ({ ...state, access, refresh, loading: false })),
  on(AuthActions.loginFailure, (state, { error }) => ({ ...state, loading: false, error })),
  on(AuthActions.refreshSuccess, (state, { access }) => ({ ...state, access })),
  on(AuthActions.refreshFailure, (state, { error }) => ({ ...state, access: null, refresh: null, error })),
  on(AuthActions.logout, state => ({ ...state, access: null, refresh: null })) // ← logout géré ici
)

variables.name: productsReducer
variables.defaultValue:
createReducer(
  initialProducts,
  on(P.loadProducts, (state, query) => ({ ...state, loading: true, error: null, lastQuery: query })),
  on(P.loadProductsSuccess, (state, { count, results, query }) => ({ ...state, loading: false, list: results, count })),
  on(P.loadProductsFailure, (state, { error }) => ({ ...state, loading: false, error })),
  on(P.loadRatingSuccess, (state, { id, avg_rating, count }) => ({ ...state, ratings: { ...state.ratings, [id]: { avg_rating, count } } }))
)

variables.name: refreshFailure
variables.defaultValue: createAction('[Auth] Refresh Failure', props<{ error: any }>())

variables.defaultValue: createAction('[Auth] Refresh Success', props<{ access: string }>())

variables.name: routes
variables.defaultValue:
[
  { path: '', component: HomeComponent, pathMatch: 'full' },
  { path: 'dev', component: DevIndexComponent },
  { path: 'dev/auth', component: DevAuthComponent },
  { path: 'dev/products', component: DevProductsComponent },
  { path: 'dev/products/:id/rating', component: DevProductRatingComponent },
  { path: 'app', component: AppPlaceholderComponent },
  { path: 'app/login', component: LoginPageComponent },

  // Routes protégées avec AuthGuard
  { path: 'app/shop/products', component: ProductsPageComponent, canActivate: [AuthGuard] },
  { path: 'app/shop/products/rating', component: ProductRatingPageComponent, canActivate: [AuthGuard] },
  { path: 'app/shop/products/:id', component: ProductDetailsPageComponent, canActivate: [AuthGuard] },
  { path: 'app/shop/cart', component: CartPageComponent, canActivate: [AuthGuard] },
  { path: 'app/shop/wishlist', component: WishlistPageComponent, canActivate: [AuthGuard] },
  { path: 'app/shop/checkout/summary', component: Step1SummaryComponent, canActivate: [AuthGuard] },
  { path: 'app/shop/checkout/address', component: Step2AddressComponent, canActivate: [AuthGuard] },
  { path: 'app/shop/checkout/confirm', component: Step3ConfirmComponent, canActivate: [AuthGuard] },

  { path: '**', redirectTo: '' },
]

createReducer(
  initialAuthState,
  on(AuthActions.login, state => ({ ...state, loading: true, error: null })),
  on(AuthActions.loginSuccess, (state, { access, refresh }) => ({ ...state, access, refresh, loading: false })),
  on(AuthActions.loginFailure, (state, { error }) => ({ ...state, loading: false, error })),
  on(AuthActions.refreshSuccess, (state, { access }) => ({ ...state, access })),

)

src/app/state/products/products.actions..defaultValue: createAction('[Products] Load', props<{ page?: number; pageSize?: number; minRating?: number; ordering?: string }>())

src/app/state/products/products.actions..name: loadProductsFailure
src/app/state/products/products.actions..defaultValue: createAction('[Products] Load Failure', props<{ error: any }>())

src/app/state/products/products.actions..name: loadProductsSuccess
src/app/state/products/products.actions..defaultValue: createAction('[Products] Load Success', props<{ count: number; results: any[]; query: any }>())

src/app/state/products/products.actions..name: loadProductSuccess
src/app/state/products/products.actions..defaultValue: createAction('[Products] Load Product Success',props<{ product: Product }>())

src/app/state/products/products.actions..name: loadRating
src/app/state/products/products.actions..defaultValue: createAction('[Products] Load Rating', props<{ id: number }>())

src/app/state/products/products.actions..name: loadRatingFailure
src/app/state/products/products.actions..defaultValue: createAction('[Products] Load Rating Failure', props<{ error: any }>())

src/app/state/products/products.actions..name: loadRatingSuccess
src/app/state/products/products.actions..defaultValue: createAction('[Products] Load Rating Success', props<{ id: number; avg_rating: number; count: number }>())

src/app/state/auth/auth.actions.ts.name: login
src/app/state/auth/auth.actions.ts.defaultValue: createAction('[Auth] Login', props<{ username: string; password: string }>())

src/app/state/auth/auth.actions.ts.name: loginFailure
src/app/state/auth/auth.actions.ts.defaultValue: createAction('[Auth] Login Failure', props<{ error: any }>())

src/app/state/auth/auth.actions.ts.name: loginSuccess
src/app/state/auth/auth.actions.ts.defaultValue: createAction('[Auth] Login Success', props<{ access: string; refresh: string }>())

src/app/state/auth/auth.actions.ts.name: refreshFailure
src/app/state/auth/auth.actions.ts.defaultValue: createAction('[Auth] Refresh Failure', props<{ error: any }>())

src/app/state/auth/auth.actions.ts.name: refreshSuccess
src/app/state/auth/auth.actions.ts.defaultValue: createAction('[Auth] Refresh Success', props<{ access: string }>())

src/app/state/auth/auth.actions.ts.name: refreshToken
src/app/state/auth/auth.actions.ts.defaultValue: createAction('[Auth] Refresh Token', props<{ refresh: string }>())

src/app/app.routes.ts.name: routes
src/app/app.routes.ts.defaultValue:
[
  { path: '', component: HomeComponent, pathMatch: 'full' },
  { path: 'dev', component: DevIndexComponent },
  { path: 'dev/auth', component: DevAuthComponent },
  { path: 'dev/products', component: DevProductsComponent },
  { path: 'dev/products/:id/rating', component: DevProductRatingComponent },
  { path: 'app', component: AppPlaceholderComponent },
  { path: 'app/login', component: LoginPageComponent },

  // Routes protégées avec AuthGuard
  { path: 'app/shop/products', component: ProductsPageComponent, canActivate: [AuthGuard] },
  { path: 'app/shop/products/rating', component: ProductRatingPageComponent, canActivate: [AuthGuard] },
  { path: 'app/shop/products/:id', component: ProductDetailsPageComponent, canActivate: [AuthGuard] },
  { path: 'app/shop/cart', component: CartPageComponent, canActivate: [AuthGuard] },
  { path: 'app/shop/wishlist', component: WishlistPageComponent, canActivate: [AuthGuard] },
  { path: 'app/shop/checkout/summary', component: Step1SummaryComponent, canActivate: [AuthGuard] },
  { path: 'app/shop/checkout/address', component: Step2AddressComponent, canActivate: [AuthGuard] },
  { path: 'app/shop/checkout/confirm', component: Step3ConfirmComponent, canActivate: [AuthGuard] },

  { path: '**', redirectTo: '' },
]
